page.title: 11Wood Craftsman
page.content: In the middle of the village is a wood crafsman he is Mr Wilkinson. Mr Wilkinson started woodwork at school age but has been working on his own for 15 years. The most expensive wood is Indian Rosewood.Pine is usualy the cheapest wood. Both Oak and Chestnut are the same in grain.Oak usually has the same pattern repeated but Chestnut is streaky. He recently made all the furniture for a church in Thornaby,all in Ash.It took him five and a half months. It usually takes him 5 days to make a moderate sized table.The most unusual thing he has been asked to make is Scotch Hands which are butter pats. Teak is an oily wood so it is used for garden funiture. You can varnish,fume in ammonia and stain wood to get a different effect
